Introduction¶

CONTACT Tasks and its clearly structured cockpit provide users with a complete personalized overview of all pending tasks and checklist items with direct access to the most important context information and sign-off functions.

CONTACT Tasks offers the user a number of options for displaying tasks. By deciding where to focus your attention, you can be sure that you have the best possible overview, and therefore maximum control, over your tasks. The menu bar and the editing options provide numerous possibilities.

Tasks¶

Tasks are the basic elements of processes, projects and inspection plans, among other objects. They form the foundation of collaborative teamwork and define who is responsible for which activities by which deadline. CONTACT Tasks provides an overview of your personal tasks and supports you in prioritizing and completing your tasks.

Note

CONTACT Tasks displays different task types. Your administrator defined these task types during configuration.

Task types¶

The following task types are displayed as standard:

  • Project tasks
  • Checklists
  • Open issues
  • Actions
  • Workflow tasks for information, completion, approval and checking

Note

The task type determines:

  • Which table columns are populated with information
  • Which units of information are displayed in the detail area

The CONTACT Tasks application¶

CONTACT Tasks displays a table containing all of your tasks. This table allows you to:

  • View the tasks
  • Configure the way in which the table, and therefore the tasks, are represented
  • Control and manage the revision statuses of the tasks

Viewing the tasks¶

You will see:

  • The name of the task
  • The party responsible for the task
  • The status of the task
  • The associated project
  • The due date

As well as other information. The number of columns in your table is determined by your settings.

Configuring how the tasks are represented¶

Within the table, you can:

  • filter
  • Edit the column width and order of the columns
  • Hide columns
  • Group

Managing the revision statuses of the tasks¶

You can manage the revision statuses of your tasks.

You can:

  • Delegate tasks to another employee
  • Gain an overview of the status of a task owned by another employee
  • View the details of each individual task
  • Change the status of your tasks
  • Enter additional information in tags
  • Open the info data sheet for the task
  • Take part in discussions relating to the tasks
  • Navigate to the parent context objects (e.g. projects or documents) or to the parent tasks
